content: Possibly, I’m more of a fan of monotheism than religion per se. I agree with [Georg] Hegel’s remarks on polytheism that may not be conducive to political order. I’d say that’s still an uncertain question, but it’s a worry I have. And as [David] Hume pointed out, monotheism itself breaks down into partial polytheism because people want multiple things to worship, to pray to, to talk to. So it’s not a stable balance.
